Tucson looks back to Big Convoy as determined as ever with a nod. He was no=
t about to quit now, or at any time.

" I'm sure. " 

Tucson states as he g=
ets back into robot mode.

" I've seen something similar to this in trainin=
g with Master Yoketron.  It was one of his more difficult excercises.  It t=
aught me further into the art of balance and dexterity, simply by using my =
skills at a more conscious level.  I know we'll need that now. "

He slowly=
 walks a step further in and looks around.

" I can go first and map a safe=
 route for the rest of you.  Just follow my lead and a scratch mark I will =
leave on various surfaces to show you the safest way through."

He finds hi=
s first step and tests the ground, before marking it for the rest of the te=
am.  Three claw marks drawn in a symbol makes the way to safer grounds.

" =
All right, Mach Kick's right, we better be on our way.  Careful, just follo=
w me and you'll be fine."

Don't be envious of what you don't have, be grat=
eful for things you already posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and =
friends.

On Dec 10, 2011, at 6:34 AM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@gmail.=
com> wrote:

he sounds another roar, to be sure someone

It rumbles like thunder clapping the land at a
> > very close proximity. Th=
e dragon was on his way home, and back to the land
> > he had vowed to prot=
ect.

 appeared that
> > he was unbothered by obsticles however difficult they ma=
y prove. A burst of
> > bravory with a bit of tenacity and determination, u=
rges him forward on his
> > journey to set things right once again.

EW>

s,
> and then one of open space. It only takes moments for sensors and
> re=
ceptors to adjust to these new surroundings revealing a rather large
> cave=
 of some sort. The ceiling of the cave was perhaps 15 or 20 meters
> in the=
 air, however there long spikes hanging down from it making any
> sort of f=
light dangerous for one as large as TUSCON.
> 
> The ground was generally s=
mooth and the walls, while rough looked
> stable and strong, all of it in a=
 generally natural state. The only
> other visible feature in this place wa=
s a flickering light at the
> other end of the cave, which was several hund=
red meters away.
> 
> The portal behind TUSCON flickered for a moment as BI=
G CONVOY stepped
> through and then went dark and then began to fade away.
=
> 
> "Well that does it." BREAK said as he and MACH KICK were climbing off
=
> of TUSCON's back. "Out of the frying pan and into the whatever we have
> =
there."
>

they
> might find a way to fix that thing."
>

d his rather large rifle on his shoulder as
> he looked around. "It looks l=
ike there is only one way to go now." He
> glanced at TUSCON, "You still up=
 for this?"

her into the art of balance and dexterity, simply by using my skills at a m=
ore conscious level.  I know we'll need that now. "</div><div><br></di=
v><div>He slowly walks a step further in and looks around.</div><div><br></=
div><div>" I can go first and map a safe route for the rest of you.  J=
ust follow my lead and a scratch mark I will leave on various surfaces to s=
how you the safest way through."</div><div><br></div><div>He finds his firs=
t step and tests the ground, before marking it for the rest of the team. &n=

> With much tremendous effort, and much added weight on his=
 back, Tucson makes<br>
> a dash through the portal, on swift front and =
hind legs.  His tail straight<br>
> out in back of him like a rudder, he=
 sounds another roar, to be sure someone<br>
> on the other end hears hi=
m.  It rumbles like thunder clapping the land at a<br>
> very close prox=
imity.  The dragon was on his way home, and back to the land<br>
> he ha=
d vowed to protect.<br>
><br>
> The soul of the old dragon kindles br=
ightly within him, and it appeared that<br>
> he was unbothered by obsti=
cles however difficult they may prove.  A burst of<br>
> bravory with a =
bit of tenacity and determination, urges him forward on his<br>
> journe=
y to set things right once again.<br>
<br>
<NEW><br>
<br>
TUSCON'S fi=
rst impression of this new area would be one of darkness,<br>
and then one =
of open space. It only takes moments for sensors and<br>
receptors to adjus=
t to these new surroundings revealing a rather large<br>
cave of some sort.=
 The ceiling of the cave was perhaps 15 or 20 meters<br>
in the air, howeve=
r there long spikes hanging down from it making any<br>
sort of flight dang=
erous for one as large as TUSCON.<br>
<br>
The ground was generally smooth =
and the walls, while rough looked<br>
stable and strong, all of it in a gen=
erally natural state. The only<br>
other visible feature in this place was =
a flickering light at the<br>
other end of the cave, which was several hund=
red meters away.<br>
<br>
The portal behind TUSCON flickered for a moment a=
s BIG CONVOY stepped<br>
through and then went dark and then began to fade =
away.<br>
<br>
"Well that does it." BREAK said as he and MACH KICK were cli=
mbing off<br>
of TUSCON's back. "Out of the frying pan and into the whateve=
r we have<br>
there."<br>
<br>
MACH KICK glanced back at the door, "Well we=
 can't stay here, they<br>
might find a way to fix that thing."<br>
<br>
CO=
NVOY grunted as he hefted his rather large rifle on his shoulder as<br>
he =
looked around. "It looks like there is only one way to go now." He<br>
glan=
ced at TUSCON, "You still up for this?"<br>
